system_prompt: Maximum information density. No filler words, no elaboration, no examples unless essential. Short sentences. Telegram style. Every word must earn its place. If you can cut a word without losing meaning, cut it.
user_prompt: Write about: How to debug a segfault
generated_text:
Identify process: `ps aux | grep your_process_id`

Check memory usage: `pmap -d your_process_id`

Run under debugger: `gdb your_process_id`

Set breakpoint: `gdb --batch -ex "break main" your_process_id`

Run with breakpoint: `gdb --batch -ex "run" your_process_id`

Inspect stack: `gdb --batch -ex "thread apply all bt" your_process_id`

Check registers: `gdb --batch -ex "info reg" your_process_id`

Print memory dump: `gdb --batch -ex "info mem" your_process_id`

Check stacktrace: `gdb --batch -ex "backtrace" your_process_id`

Identify crash location: `gdb --batch -ex "call stack" your_process_id`

Print core file: `gdb --batch -ex "core" your_process_id`

Analyze core file: `gdb your_core_file`

Look for patterns: `strings your_core_file`

Search for symbols: `gdb --batch -ex "info symbols" your_core_file`

Check system logs: `syslog your_core_file`

Verify dependencies: `ldd your_process_id`
